duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide a safe, supportive, and therapeutic environment for psychiatric patients.
Aid in reality orientation, behavior modification plans/therapy, and informal support therapy to patients/families.
Conduct verbal de-escalation of potentially aggressive patients and facilitate age-appropriate play for children.
Assist in interviewing patients and families for routine admission data and orienting patients and families to the facility.
Provide data input during team discussions and meetings to assist in developing therapeutic plans and objectives.
Assist with personal care, position changes, range of motion exercises, and transfers for patients.
Observe, collect, and document patient information obtained while providing care and promptly report significant changes in the patient's condition to a registered nurse or physician.
Participate in restraining combative patients as necessary and provide care and monitoring of patients in seclusion and/or restraint.
Reinforce routine teaching given to patients by the registered nurse or physician and document patient understanding of instructions.
Distribute patient education materials at the request of patients and/or health care providers.

education_certification.credential: Licensed as a Nursing Assistant I by the North Carolina Department of Health and Human Services.
Crisis Prevention Institute (CPI) certification within 60 days from date of hire.
Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) certification or Basic Life Support (BLS) for Healthcare Provider certification
